contentrichtext.text: {{Italic title}}{{Taxobox | name = ''Rhithropanopeus harrisii'' | image = Rhithropanopeus harissi.JPG | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Arthropod]]a | subphylum = [[Crustacean|Crustacea]] | classis = [[Malacostraca]] | ordo = [[Decapoda]] | infraordo = [[Crab|Brachyura]] | familia = [[Panopeidae]] | genus = '''''Rhithropanopeus''''' | genus_authority = [[Mary J. Rathbun|Rathbun]], 1898 | species = '''''R. harrisii''''' | binomial = ''Rhithropanopeus harrisii'' | binomial_authority = ([[Augustus Addison Gould|Gould]], 1841) <ref name="Ng">{{cite journal |journal=[[Raffles Bulletin of Zoology]] |year=2008 |volume=17 |pages=1–286 |title=Systema Brachyurorum: Part I. An annotated checklist of extant Brachyuran crabs of the world |author=P. K. L. Ng, D. Guinot & P. J. F. Davie |url=http://rmbr.nus.edu.sg/rbz/biblio/s17/s17rbz.pdf}}</ref> | synonyms = ''Pilumnus harrisii'' <small>Gould, 1841</small><br/> ''Pilumnus tridentatus'' <small>[[R. T. Maitland|Maitland]], 1874</small><br/> ''Heteropanope tridentatus'' <small>[[Tesch]], 1922</small><br /> ''Panopeus wurdemannii'' <small>Gibbes, 1850</small> | synonyms_ref =  <ref name="Ng"/> }} '''''Rhithropanopeus harrisii''''' ([[common name]]s include the ''[[Zuider Zee|Zuiderzee]] crab'',<ref name="JNCC">{{cite web |url=http://www.jncc.gov.uk/page-1710 |publisher=[[Joint Nature Conservation Committee]] |title=''Rhithropanopeus harrisii'' |author=Dr C. Mettam & P. F. Clark |accessdate=December 10, 2009}}</ref> ''dwarf crab'',<ref name="JNCC"/> ''estuarine mud crab'',<ref name="USGS"/> ''Harris mud crab'',<ref name="USGS"/> and ''white-tipped mud crab''), is a small [[omnivore|omnivorous]] [[crab]] native to [[Atlantic Ocean|Atlantic]] coasts of the [[Americas]], from [[New Brunswick]] to northern [[Brazil]].<ref name="JNCC"/> ''R. harrisii'' is usually found in [[brackish]] water, but can also be found in [[freshwater]]. It likes to live on stones and in [[oyster]] beds. The crab can reach a maximum size of {{convert|20|mm|in|1}}. It has an olive-green-brownish color, sometimes with dark spots on its [[carapace]]. It is a common inhabitant of [[Texas]] and [[Florida]] [[estuary|estuaries]], but was later introduced all over the world.<ref name="USGS">{{cite web |url=http://nas.er.usgs.gov/queries/FactSheet.asp?speciesID=197 |title=''Rhithropanopeus harrisii'' (Gould, 1841) |author=Harriet Perry |date=April 24, 2006}}</ref> In 1937, it was discovered to be invading the [[San Francisco Bay]]'s brackish waters and adjacent fresh waters of the [[California Central Valley]].<ref name="USGS"/> It was also recently discovered in the [[Third Lock Lake]] in [[Panama]], a man-made lake intended to be a part of the [[Panama Canal]].<ref>{{cite journal |title=Established population of the North American Harris mud crab, ''Rhithropanopeus harrisii'' (Gould 1841) (Crustacea: Brachyura: Xanthidae) in the Panama Canal |author=Dominique G. Roche & Mark E. Torchin |journal=[[Aquatic Invasions]] |year=2007 |volume=2 |issue=3 |pages=155–161 |doi=10.3391/ai.2007.2.3.1 |url=http://www.aquaticinvasions.net/2007/AI_2007_2_3_Roche_Torchin.pdf}}</ref> ''R. harrisii'' was first discovered in [[Europe]] in the [[Zuider Zee]], the [[Netherlands]], and is now also found in [[Denmark]], [[Belgium]], [[Germany]], [[France]], [[Poland]], [[Russia]], [[Romania]] and [[Bulgaria]], from the [[Black Sea]] and [[Caspian Sea]].<ref name="JNCC"/> In the [[British Isles]], ''R. harrisii'' has only been observed in [[Cardiff Docks|Roath Docks]], [[Cardiff]], which have lower [[salinity]] (12[[Per mil|‰]]) than the surrounding waters. Breeding [[fresh water|freshwater]] populations have been found in the [[Brazos River]] basin in [[Texas]], notably the [[Possum Kingdom State Park]] and [[Lake Granbury]]. Populations have also been discovered in [[Lake Texoma]].<ref>{{cite journal |author=Terrence Boyle, Jr., Donald Keith & Russell Pfau |year=2010 |title=Occurrence, reproduction, and population genetics of the estuarine mud crab, ''Rhithropanopeus harrisii'' (Gould) (Decapoda, Panopidae) in Texas freshwater reservoirs |journal=[[Crustaceana]] |volume=83 |issue=4 |pages=493–505 |doi=10.1163/001121610X492148}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist|32em}} [[Category:Xanthoidea]] [[Category:Crustaceans of the Atlantic Ocean]] [[Category:Invasive crustacean species]] [[Category:Animals described in 1841]]
